RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight All owances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICING angled in shortly after the start and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. NOID was shut off early then saved ground, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, cleared second past the eighth pole and was gaining late on the winner. C R'S MANDATE rounded the opening turn about the four path, picked up the chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and finished evenly to take third mid-stretch. HOT FUDGE SONDE was shuffled back soon after the start and saved ground, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out past the eighth pole and finished evenly. JUBA'S NOTION rated close inside, challenged at the three eighths pole but flattened stride while drifting on the far turn. HUMPTY GRUMPTY was shuffled back at the start, settled in the three path on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. SMALL FIELD saved ground. The Stewards reviewed claims of foul against the rider of Icing for interference soon after the start, lodged by the riders of Noid and Hot Fudge Sonde. As a result, Icing was disqualified to fourth place.

ENTRY.NAME: Hot Fudge Sonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,saved ground,bid 3/8,off rail turn,even fnish

ENTRY.NAME: Noid
ENTRY.COMMENT: shut off early,saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,gaining late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 21100. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ADARA rated a slim lead inside, dueled clear approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. ONLY GET'N BETTER saved ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn, drifted leaving the turn and settled for second. NET WORTH raced with the early pace two deep, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. CRYPTIC CODE rounded the first turn about the three path then saved ground on the second turn, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. CAN'T STOP MAXEY raced four wide on the first turn then raced with the pace from the three quarter pole, dueled passing the three eighths but dropped back approaching the quarter pole and flattened at the rail on the far turn. BIG REDWHITEBLUE raced in the five path on the turns, left the second turn outside and showed little response. PRINCE'S REWARD ducked out and made contact with SHAKIN IT BIG TIME leaving the gate, raced close in the two and three paths, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened on the far turn. The latter was bumped leaving the gate, rounded the opening turn about the four path, raced outside into the backstretch and showed little response from the seven sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Adara
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,dueled clear near 1/4,rail far turn,driving

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. David Richardson, North HanoverBloodstock & Empire Mak

ENTRY.NAME: Can't Stop Maxey
ENTRY.OWNER: A P Stable and Fox Tale Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACHEN'S RIDGE took a quick lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, drifted leaving the turn but widened under steady stretch handling. AIR MEDAL rated close inside, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and dueled through the stretch for second. SPECTACULO settled close off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, eased out in the upper stretch and finished evenly to take third the final yards. IN JUBALATION stalked the earlier pace from the three and four paths, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close two deep on the far turn, was carried out into the lane then flattened the final sixteenth. CHASE LIL ME rounded the opening turn about the four path, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn, left the turn outside and showed little in the lane. TYRY TYRANNOSAURUS raced three wide, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and showed little in the stretch. PONTICELLO saved ground. JEFFERSON SECURITY raced with the early pace then stalked into the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Air Medal
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 7/16,off rail far turn,dueled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Spectaculo
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled close,bid 3/8,3p far turn,evenly lane,up 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Ponticello
ENTRY.OWNER: Sperling Nancie S and Racanelli Mark Joseph

ENTRY.NAME: Machen's Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 1/4,rail far turn,drifted,widen

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 36300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE NIGHT MIKE settled in the three and four paths on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and took the lead two deep toward the quarter, dueled clear midway on the far turn and was kept sharp through the lane. SPANGLISH rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and dueled through the final sixteenth for second. HONEYQUIST took the lead three wide nearing the first turn, was met at even terms approaching the half mile pole and dueled nearing the three eighths, was caught at the rail toward the quarter and flattened mid-stretch. PENGUIN PARADE saved early ground, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the two and three paths then flattened in the lane. TIMMY settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the four path of the far turn. HAPPY YEARS showed little response through the backstretch. SARGENT KOBE had a brief early lead inside, was met at the rail into the first turn, dropped back and gave chase into the backstretch, but gave way into the far turn. THUNDERINREADYRICK steadied lightly at the start then rated close four wide from the three quarter pole, moved to even terms nearing the half mile pole, gave chase from that point but gave way into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Spanglish
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 1/2,off rail far turn,dueled 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

ENTRY.NAME: Honeyquist
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC Ultra Championship Racing LLC and Mill

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Years
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Shaver Stephen

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Marc h 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIDICULOUS saved early ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily progressed in the three path of the far turn, dueled for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. UNCAPTURED KING rounded the opening turn in the three path, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, improved at the rail on the far turn then dug in through the lane to take the nod for second under the wire. AUBURN MILL took a quick lead while tapering in and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, dueled clear of Flat Cat approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail through the far turn but was met mid-stretch and gave up the nod for second under the wire. ROYAL THUNDER rated close, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in range of the lead in the four path of the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. SAG HARBOR saved ground, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. FLAT CAT tapered in and stalked two deep, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back toward the quarter and weakened off the rail approaching the head of the lane. ANTIPOISON was eased early and ponied off.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S HAT TRICK took the lead approaching the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, inched clear toward the quarter pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to hold on. DUNCAN IDAHO engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the far turn and dueled through the stretch to take second the final yards while gaining on the winner. JAZZ WITH DENIS became anxious in the gate then pressured the pace inside, dropped back approaching the quarter pole and relented second in the final yards. ALDARIGHTTRICKS chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. DRUNK TEXT was forced in early then gave chase inside, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. CHARITABLE WINDSOR came in at the break, picked up the chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the three path. LAST OF BAD BOYS saved ground. COURT TUDOR gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the four path. CRUSH 'N RUN raced wide.

ENTRY.NAME: Drunk Text
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in early,chased inside,off rail turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz With Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious in gate,pressed inside,dropped back 1/4,relented 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's Hat Trick
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,inched clear near 1/4,off rail turn,determined

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Confucius Say S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 103. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED THREE YEARS OLDS AND UPWARD. $50 nominations close Wednesday, April 12, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, April 19, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies a nd all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: Three Years Old 116 lbs.; Older 123 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses havinga ccumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL MISSION stalked the early pace from the three path, took the nod past the half mile pole and pulled himself clear at the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and held on under steady stretch handling. NO CHANGE raced well back saving ground on the first turn, improved leaving the turn and raced at the rail on the far turn, came between horses past the eighth pole then dueled through the final sixteenth for second. SOCIAL CHIC saved early ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four and five paths of the far turn then outfinished for second the final sixteenth. FREE SAILIN rated a slim early lead inside, was met leaving the first turn and stayed close past the half mile pole, challenged from the three eighths but dropped back at the five sixteenths and flattened through later yards. MUAD'DIB raced with the pace through the front stretch then eased out and stalked into the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close in the three path of the far turn but flattened through later yards. LATE IN THE GAME saved ground on the first turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, eased outward through the upper stretch and passed some rivals outside. JUNGLE BEAST settled off the rail on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn then flattened stride. NICO rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the five path of the far turn. CANDY INVASION broke a step slow and never factored. ROYAL PAIN rated close inside on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Late in the Game
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 3/8,rail far turn,passed rivals outside

ENTRY.NAME: Free Sailin
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met 1/2,kept close,chased 3/8,flattened late yrds

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,nod past 1/2,clear 5/16,rail far turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 22, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY CANDY BIZ rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole and contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, was met at even terms entering the stretch but dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over the game effort of HAPPY CHAMP, who stalked from the four path on the first turn and gave chase leaving the three eighths, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, moved to even terms into the lane and stayed on gamely to the finish. LADDIE LIAM rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and got up for third mid-stretch. EXCALIBUR saved ground on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, angled out looking for room through the upper stretch and finished evenly. LOST IN MANHATTAN settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path, left the turn outside and flattened later yards. FORT FORTITUDE rounded the first turn about the four path, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and weakened in the lane. KING NATE raced well back off the rail on the first turn, rounded the far turn about the seven path and passed rivals. TOP HAT TREASON rounded the first turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little response. CLOSE THE CASE had a brief early lead then stalked on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. BEYOND THE VICTORY stalked the pace from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but gave way passing the three eighths and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Excalibur
ENTRY.OWNER: Honoring Luke Stables and Kenworthy John C

ENTRY.NAME: Lost in Manhattan
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,5p far turn,outside 1/8,flattened later yard

ENTRY.NAME: Laddie Liam
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,4p far turn,up 3rd mid-stretch

ENTRY.NAME: King Nate
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back off rail,7p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
